content.title: 100 GIFS in 100  DAYS - NOUNS GIF COLLECTION
content.description:
# 100 GIFS in 100  DAYS - NOUNS GIF COLLECTION

# Feedback

I have received New feedback from the nouns. Therefore, I reconsidered two aspects:

The amount of ETH will decrease from 10 ETH to 6.5 ETH for the same quantity of GIFs.

The other point revolved around the other "nounish" GIFs. Further down in this proposal, I will detail why GIFs featuring nouns as protagonists are very important and complement those.

**Also onizuka.eth asked About Distribution:**

All the GIFs will be part of a Giphy collection in an account called 'Nouns GIFs.' Each GIF will include the 'What is Nouns DAO' video as the source. This way, every person who receives the GIF will be able to learn more about that character.

Of course, every piece of creation, including my 3D models, will be  CC0 and shared with the community. This means that in the future, if we want to turn the GIFs into collectible NFTs, we will be able to do so.

Every GIF will be shared with the Nouns Twitter account manager for distribution to the community.

All 100 GIFs and files will be stored in a folder accessible to the community at any time.

------------

# Description

I would like to share the proposal I have been working on, as I believe it could greatly benefit the proliferation of our beloved **Nouns**, something we all cherish in this community.

The proposal I have in mind is **simple** yet **powerful**: I want to create a large number of **2D** and **3D** gifs and stickers featuring Nouns characters. These gifs and stickers will be communicative, humorous and **relatable** with the aim of reaching a wider audience with Nouns characters and encouraging their recurring use.

## Goal

The goal is to make GIFs that people both inside and outside the world of nouns can use. This way, they'll start incorporating nouns into their **daily lives**. Plus, GIFs are currently one of the most viral forms of content because their primary purpose is to be shared to convey an idea, emotion, or joke.

![alt text](https://media.giphy.com/media/v1.Y2lkPTc5MGI3NjExd2kycWx5YWR1MTRyeXdhcmRlMzI0ZGI5Z3k2cG1yZGZiNzY5cjBkYSZlcD12MV9pbnRlcm5hbF9naWZfYnlfaWQmY3Q9Zw/MKr18qpDptEKhk6yWp/giphy.gif)

## Pudgy Penguins

A successful case we can take as a reference is  "Pudgy Penguins" Gif collection. With just a few months of gif publications, the Pudgies reached many new people and quickly became popular.

![alt text](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FYhMxqhWQAMKjfm.jpg)

![alt text](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fit:1244/1*_-RtCt584lViXV8EureZ_A.png)

![alt text](https://media.giphy.com/media/v1.Y2lkPTc5MGI3NjExcHI2Y2liODd3a3cwbjlvcjRxbzZtZzMxem5yOXIzN2d1ZTljOWc5byZlcD12MV9pbnRlcm5hbF9naWZfYnlfaWQmY3Q9Zw/7Z6pYYjzYNPyPkS6yb/giphy.gif)

Another important aspect is that producing gifs is more cost-effective than producing videos, and unlike videos, the gifs we create today can be used indefinitely.

## Nounish Gifs

Currently, the Nounish team is crafting some  cool GIFs for nouns. It's a clever strategy to enhance familiar images by adding the noggles on top of them. However, most regular folks probably don't know what these "noggles" are. That's why these GIFs introduce the characters behind the "noggles" brand. These will complement the current ones beautifully!

Character GIFs are very useful for a brand because users become more attached to the characters and what they represent with each passing day. Currently, neither the community nor individuals outside it have the opportunity to use small nouns to communicate, as the Pudgy Penguins community does. This proposal aims to address that need.

![alt text](https://media.giphy.com/media/v1.Y2lkPTc5MGI3NjExNm8wZHk1OHBpYzIxaWJvOWd6ZW53MWd4ZnNiMDBhM2t3Z3ZxbGVkcyZlcD12MV9pbnRlcm5hbF9naWZfYnlfaWQmY3Q9Zw/5DKoUvpIwMLPCMpr1v/giphy.gif)

## Team

To carry out this proposal, I'll be teaming up with my friend and colleague Santiago Pereyra. He will handle the 2D animations while I will take care of the 3D animations. Below, I've included some samples of our work:

3D: Created by me. 2D:Created by my friend and coworker santiago.

![alt text](https://media.giphy.com/media/v1.Y2lkPTc5MGI3NjExN3QzNzlqcjE3amw0aXU2b28wZHN6d3FzazB5NGljOWp3NmdsbXRjNCZlcD12MV9pbnRlcm5hbF9naWZfYnlfaWQmY3Q9Zw/6BYwfQe0EC1Ye2B4Ki/giphy.gif)

![alt text](https://media.giphy.com/media/v1.Y2lkPTc5MGI3NjExNm8wZHk1OHBpYzIxaWJvOWd6ZW53MWd4ZnNiMDBhM2t3Z3ZxbGVkcyZlcD12MV9pbnRlcm5hbF9naWZfYnlfaWQmY3Q9Zw/5DKoUvpIwMLPCMpr1v/giphy.gif)

![alt text](https://media.giphy.com/media/v1.Y2lkPTc5MGI3NjExZzNxbmM2eGp6amxzeHpzZzN3bjYybGNyMXIwcThrN2h3dGJ6eHhvcyZlcD12MV9pbnRlcm5hbF9naWZfYnlfaWQmY3Q9Zw/ekuly58GoGGqk57CaP/giphy.gif)
![alt text](https://media.giphy.com/media/v1.Y2lkPTc5MGI3NjExbmJ5bjNmbmQxd24wc3kyZ3htczl5cHF5bHZ4dWwyaGhmOHQ5ZHltdyZlcD12MV9pbnRlcm5hbF9naWZfYnlfaWQmY3Q9Zw/dOot83N6QDS8iiJqn5/giphy.gif)
![alt text](https://media.giphy.com/media/v1.Y2lkPTc5MGI3NjExdDJnaWZybWxzdm1tOGxkcnVucGtncDd4Y3VueHoxaGIwdGsycTFzMSZlcD12MV9pbnRlcm5hbF9naWZfYnlfaWQmY3Q9Zw/aVxuO21qfnHROCiXG0/giphy.gif)

## Animation For lil Nouns.

I have also created animations for Lil Nouns (I plan to make more and test them on social media).
You can see them right here ( SOUND ON): [Anim1](https://www.youtube.com/shorts/VI_cdD-bX3I)
[Anim2](https://www.youtube.com/shorts/ErG0HCJN98E)
[Anim3](https://www.youtube.com/shorts/337gPPO0gfo)

Also i am finishing a little shortfilm for Nouns Amigos:  Here is a really rough cut, without sound, details, I show it anyways but this is far to be finished: [Sample](https://youtu.be/snh-fHehxww)

To sum it up, I have been creating content for nouns for a while, and I would love to double down on this effort and create the best possible Nouns GIF collection

I think that the best way is to start small and then if the dao wants we can keep doing more so i will make a prop asking for : 6.5 ETH

## DETAILS


Time to produce each GIF: 4-6 hours.

**Cost per hour:** $40.

**Cost per GIF: $160** - $240.

TOTAL **for 100 GIFS** : $16000 - $24000.

As we are making a big batch, we can easily round it to $16000, which is approximately  **10 ETH.**   (Some Nouns said that the ask is to big, so it will be 6.5 ETH)

## Thank you VERY MUCH for Reading the entire PROP!

content.title: Wet Butt, So What? Noun’s Bidet Revolution! ⌐◨-◨
content.description:
# Wet Butt, So What? Noun’s Bidet Revolution! ⌐◨-◨ 

# Wet Butt, So What? Noun’s Bidet Revolution! ⌐◨-◨ 

# 

# 

![7yrfsm|360x202](https://global.discourse-cdn.com/standard17/uploads/lilnouns/original/1X/cabbf3a0f8ac0e780c24f7becadad5b494f530ba.gif)




# **Wet Butt, So What? Noun's Bidet Revolution!** 
# TLDR
MakeWater is seeking $34,000 USDC to provide low-income families with Nouns-branded bidets, educate the community on their benefits, and produce high-quality video content showcasing the initiative.

# Summary 

With a $34,000 proposal, MakeWater aims to shift U.S. bathroom culture by promoting bidets, a net positive for the environment and households. Bidets can slash toilet paper costs, boost hygiene, and ease water infrastructure stress. Our pilot will provide Nouns-branded bidets to low-to-middle-income families, complete with DIY installation videos. 
The initiative involves an educational drive where students, acting as citizen scientists, gather and share data on bidet usage and delve into water issues in their region. This hands-on approach also includes field trips to local water facilities, providing them with a comprehensive understanding of bidet advantages. By partnering with water utilities and local governments, we envision a self-sustaining model, continually championing bidet use. 
As this initiative grabs headlines, Nouns will stand out as the pioneering force behind it. Your support will be the kickstart we need!

**Update** We’ve updated the proposal after listening to feedback and reduced the initial ask, explained our goal for a self-sustained program (no future nouns funding required), and highlighted how Nouns will be seen as the hero catalyzing this revolutionary change in bathroom culture.







# How will it work?
[![Screen Shot 2023-09-20 at 10.20.35 AM|690x388](https://global.discourse-cdn.com/standard17/uploads/lilnouns/original/1X/64fdc44ca71b4895023689cf724500b0b393e1b8.jpeg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zr56zofQX2o)
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zr56zofQX2o](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zr56zofQX2o)

Our  journey will start with our pilot program in South Texas which will be a pivotal step for data collection, refining strategies, and pinpointing best practices. We are delighted to have already gained the enthusiastic support and active engagement of local utilities and educators,  who will propel the growth of our community and our vision.
Through our ongoing community-building efforts, we will strive to gather a strong initial group of participants in South Texas, our pilot region. Far from being just beneficiaries, these participants will become pioneers, actively contributing to data collection and shaping a communal narrative through social media engagement. These authentic stories, personal experiences and testimonials,  will initiate a cultural shift towards bidet use and create a united front against water wastage.
The Nouns DAO can kickstart this effort, providing the initial push needed to get the ball rolling. But this isn't just a one-time splash; it's a tide of transformation! The real heart of this initiative is its ability to keep going on its own. Our goal is more than just handing out affordable bidets; it's about making a lasting change in how people use bathrooms in America.
This initiative will be a wave of change that keeps building and reaching farther. Our pilot program marks the first splash, but together, we have the power to reshape perspectives, enhance water sustainability, and fundamentally revolutionize water habits across the United States.

**Want a Limited Edition Golden Nouns Bidet ⌐◨-◨?** 
Donate 0.05 ETH or more at  [https://app.endaoment.org/orgs/81-1369592](https://app.endaoment.org/orgs/81-1369592).
All contributions further our mission, and as a token of our appreciation, you'll receive the exclusive bidet.


# Why Bidets?
Enter the humble toilet-mounted bidet — a nifty contraption that adds a touch of luxury to your bathroom routine. It replaces or fits beneath the toilet seat and uses a a nozzle to spray water for cleansing. Its installation is easy and doesn't demand a plumbing professional. Many models even showcase features like adjustable pressure, temperature control, and self-cleaning. Beyond all that, however, lies an ecological marvel— a cost-effective solution that promotes better hygiene while reducing toilet paper waste.

Bidets have garnered worldwide recognition for their remarkable water-saving abilities and paper-reducing magic. Embracing bidets translates to preserving trees, conserving water, and reducing the energy dedicated to manufacturing and transporting toilet paper.

Their appeal isn't just environmental; it's also rooted in hygiene. Bidets offer hands-free, pristine cleanliness, an invaluable health advantage, especially in a time when global health awareness is at its peak.

Our aging water infrastructure poses yet another challenge. Sewage systems of many cities groan under the weight of non-degradable items. These infrastructures were designed for a different era, and non-degradable products like wet wipes weren't part of the plan. Despite their convenience, wipes don't break down in water like toilet paper does. This leads to stubborn blockages, damages to equipment, and ultimately, significant repair costs that households and communities have to bear.

Bidets, however, offer a sustainable lifeboat. By adopting bidets, we curtail clogs and damages, sparing households and cities from hefty repair costs. It's not just a bathroom upgrade; it's a blueprint for economic resilience, environmental harmony, and public health.





## Our Background
[![Screen Shot 2023-09-20 at 10.20.35 AM|690x388](https://global.discourse-cdn.com/standard17/uploads/lilnouns/original/1X/4d1175bec0882ed790ebee5f64ef9998d4ab6125.jpeg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0thwr7QItyE)
[Video of our Lil Nouns Water Purification Kits built in partnership with the Light House for the Blind Nonprofit https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0thwr7QItyE](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0thwr7QItyE)
![79685689a8627fcb69f5c7a138529474869a119a_2_1034x748|690x499](https://global.discourse-cdn.com/standard17/uploads/lilnouns/optimized/1X/79685689a8627fcb69f5c7a138529474869a119a_2_1034x748.jpeg)
Lil Nouns Kits at our Black Girls Code Event in Houston. 

![|217x384](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/S_Kp1aNv2LHDB43Vd7I0bRW3nyPCIiP2lVjTWbgxXiDGTn70Y_I0Se93u0w_tHlnoWD1LzBKB4_w7iqBBz-8_Ogbj9kYiRXvt1rOCAVEyVv9r_UjpoFAu0OBOYZCEgScAS1bb44qldiFXtw4YtwVXWI)

*View MakeWater Endaoment Donation History https://app.endaoment.org/orgs/81-1369592
* In June 2022, Lil Nouns passed our 3,000 nouns kits for students proposal by a resounding 211 to 4 vote (➡️see [here](https://lilnouns.wtf/vote/16)).
* We teamed up with Lighthouse for the Blind to create these kits, and we marked our partnership with a video (➡️watch it[ here](https://youtu.be/0thwr7QItyE)).
* Our victory streak continued with a win at the FoodNouns Prop, where our proposal to create video vignette for our water education curriculum (click to watch our video [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sYrK_6Y_qUU), ➡️and check out our [tweet](https://twitter.com/makewaterorg/status/1659299148066177024?s=20)) garnered unanimous support (➡️see our %100 positive votes in [here](https://www.foodnouns.wtf/vote/3)).
* We’ve also received a positive response Lil Nouns PropHouse (Open Round 12) for our proposal asking Lil Nouns to be a 3D printer prize sponsor for World Water Day youth competition (➡️see [here](https://prop.house/lil-nouns/round-12-open/3649)).
* Nounish Team also highlighted our work on World Water Day, with a reel showcasing our work and our ongoing partnership with the community (➡️see [here](https://youtube.com/shorts/4rzK2iCFoWA?feature=share)).
* Beyond our cherished Nouns community, our network encompasses educators, water utilities, and beyond. We're thrilled to also be introducing a dynamic video element to our project, guided by collaborator GJ Castro, an accomplished videographer with credits in Nat Geo, Discovery, and Food Network.
* And there's no pause in our progress – our first batch of bidets is on the way for testing. We are ready turn ripples of innovation into a tidal wave of impact! 

## Our Team

![noun ryan profile|100x100](https://global.discourse-cdn.com/standard17/uploads/lilnouns/original/1X/e44ec94f69e1dc098e78fab8ea97041b763e9caa.jpeg)

## Outcomes / Deliverables

content.title: Propdates 2.0
content.description:
# Propdates 2.0

*“What ever happened to Prop #123?”
“What was the most successful Nouns proposal?”
“Which proposals should we try to repeat?”
“Who are our most committed contributors?”*

[Propdates](https://updates.wtf) is here to answer these questions. With contracts built by Wilson, Propdates is the best way to keep up with Nouns proposals after they pass, and an entirely new design space within the greater Nouns ecosystem. We’ve never had any consistent, onchain way to keep track of contributors’ work, and no way to recommend regular updates. Down the line, one could imagine Propdates as an onchain oracle for proposal progress.

## PROGRESS SO FAR
I built the Propdates site and public graph, inspired by Krel’s [requests.wtf](http://requests.wtf). What started as a weekend experiment has grown into something much bigger: it’s clear that we’ve tapped into something special. In fact, Propdates has already become part of the pre-proposal conversation process - it is expected that a proposer regularly updates the DAO on their work. In just a few weeks, we already have had 17 unique posters, and more coming.

![](https://i.ibb.co/mt9nCgz/metrics.png)
![](https://i.ibb.co/CzXyQrg/other.png)

## LOOKING AHEAD
We’d like to move Propdates from an experiment to a fully-featured Nouns app and a key part of the ecosystem, on par with teams like Agora, Federation, Prop House. Our end goal is for Propdates to be a protocol any contract or app can plug into to determine a proposal’s success. It is clear that it could expand further than just Nouns.

We are asking for three months of funding (more on the team below). Martin will be close to full-time, but working on other projects as well (similar to almost all software proposers). We expect Onion to be part time for two months or so. For these months, our priorities will be:
1.  Contract improvements to expand functionality  & data
	- New channels to post updates in: prop house entries, user channels, custom channels
	- Revamped admin system / permissions + “Super Admin” to unlock proposals where proposer is unresponsive
	- Explore contract to update/revoke streams based on a proposal's updates
2.  Improved editor, claiming and submitting UX
	- Easy image upload via Arweave or IPFS (and potentially expand as a public good for Nouns ecosystem)
	- In-app markdown editor and previews for better UX
3.  Farcaster integration for likes & comments on updates
4.  Open Editions to celebrate Completed Props

Our goals by January 31st, 2024 are:
-   150 proposals marked as completed
-   400 updates posted
-   30 weekly updates on average

Additionally, we want to encourage past proposals to share updates on their work, but recognize it’s often hard for contributors to track down their sponsoring proposers (pre-v3). We are requesting 0.05 ETH to send to each of the first 100 successful props (before prop #363) that posts a non-trivial update as an incentive to kickstart the protocol. At the time of writing there have been 225 successful proposals, so this would go a long way to getting all proposals marked as completed.

## TEAM

-   [martin](https://twitter.com/anquetil) worked on [Mogu](http://nouns.wtf/vote/321), [Explorer Grants](http://nouns.wtf/vote/178), [Hack Week](http://nouns.wtf/vote/253)
-   [onnnnnnnion](https://twitter.com/onnnnnnnion) (solidity) worked on [BLOCKS](https://mint.fun/zora/0x1F781d47cD59257D7AA1Bd7b2fbaB50D57AF8587), [onions renderer](https://twitter.com/onnnnnnnion/status/1639045062595170307), [PH Infinite Round Committee](https://prop.house/infinite/nouns-retro-grants)

## FUNDING
-   Team: 30 ETH for three months (via Stream)
-   Incentives: 5 ETH (100 * 0.05 ETH)
-   OpEx: 2 ETH
 
We commit to posting updates on [updates.wtf](https://updates.wtf) bi-weekly to keep the community updated on our progress. If we do not update, our stream can be canceled.

contentSignatures.reason: For me, Propdates is one of the most exciting things happening in Nouns right now. Funding its continued development is critical. The ask here is reasonable, and the team has done good work so far. Appreciate Martin staying nimble and trying to serve the DAO.

content.title: Require noun age to fork (requesting feedback)
content.description:
# Require noun age to fork (requesting feedback)

We are proposing to change the forking mechanism by requiring a minimum age for any noun that wishes to fork. For example, only nouns that are at least 100 “days” old are allowed to fork.

The goal of this change is to mitigate some of the current arbitrage happening, where certain actors buy nouns on the auction only to fork with them as soon as possible. By only allowing aged nouns to fork, we are inviting more long term players to participate in the auction.

Suggested spec:
* Age will be counted by noun IDs. e.g. if the currently auctioned noun is 876, then noun #700 has age 176 days.
* The required age for forking will be a parameter configurable by the DAO, zero at first.
* The functions `escrowToFork` and `joinFork` will check for this requirement.

If we see significant support for this change we will update this proposal to include funding for an audit of this change.

content.title: The Giant Noggles: Australia's Next Iconic Tourist Attraction (phase 1)
content.description:
# The Giant Noggles: Australia's Next Iconic Tourist Attraction (phase 1)

## **Preface**

Let me just preface this with the fact that I am open to and I welcome any suggestions, feedback, changes and input. I would very much appreciate some if you have a different vision for this. None of this is set in stone per se and will utilise the edit functionality if there needs to be changes.

---

## **Introduction**

The Allure of the Big Things: Australia, with its vast landscapes and vibrant cities, has a tradition of celebrating the unique, exemplified by the nation's fondness for "big things." With the inception dating back to "Ploddy" the dinosaur in the 1960s, these colossal attractions have woven themselves into the country's cultural fabric. "The Giant Noggles" aims to be the next in this esteemed lineage, offering an experience that is not just visual, but interactive and deeply engaging.

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/H1gnFeNZ6.png)

---

## **Market Analysis**

Australia's "big things" have always been more than just roadside attractions; they've been symbolic landmarks, driving tourism and community engagement.

As of this year, there are 150+ "big things" scattered across Australia. I personally have visited many of them since a kid, but moreso now with my own young kids... they are absolutely obsessed with the big things.
`[video proof - will be added once I can track noggles on my kid's face]`

Some of these icons, like the Big Banana in Coffs Harbour, are known to draw hundreds of thousands of visitors each year. The Big Banana, in particular, underwent several expansions over the years due to its popularity, transforming from a mere oversized fruit to a park with rides, tours, and a shopping precinct. It's now reported to be generating revenue of $12 million (AUD) annually.

Revenue for these attractions can vary based on location, accessibility, and amenities. For instance, the Big Merino souvenir shop is reported to have annual sales in the six figure range, even without considering auxiliary revenue streams like cafes or tour services nearby.

The constant evolution of these attractions, coupled with their undying popularity, signals a thriving market with a penchant for the novel and the nostalgic. I believe The Giant Noggles, with its modern interactive approach, can carve its own niche in this market, attracting both domestic and international tourists. Additionally, it is likely to get nationwide news coverage.

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJI_5eEba.png)

---

## **Suitability To The Task**

I have already played a part in manufacturing the largest noggles in the world, which are currently installed at Rusutsu Resort in Hokkaido, Japan. They measure 9x3m and gained the excited attention of the nouniverse and beyond, and will continue to be embedded in the experience of the visitors to Rusutsu for potentially years to come. They will be highly visible during the upcoming Winter while placed in the middle of one of the busiest points in the resort!

Ever since we had those installed though, I have been dreaming up how to go bigger! This time around, I would like to retain the full aesthetic with the black and white lenses, while making them much, much bigger. They will likely be created using structural beams to achieve max strength and size. Making them visible from the highway while driving is the dream.

I'm Australian, currently living in Australia and I am close enough to be able to attend potential sites. Plus I understand the culture deeply and have the ability to talk to all parties needed with clarity to organise such an endeavour.

---

## **Location & Accessibility**

### **Prime Visibility**:
The target location is along Australia's bustling east coast highway, the M1 between Sydney and Gold Coast to ensure The Giant Noggles become an unmissable landmark. Such strategic positioning not only maximizes visibility to the huge amount of traffic that travles this highway year round, but also facilitates easy access for travelers and tourists. Clear signages will be crucial to guide visitors, making their approach and journey hassle-free. With the right location, it could bode well for getting Tesla superchargers installed on site to help extend their network too.

### **Land Considerations**:
While I haven't secured land or entered into formal discussions, this proposal seeks to facilitate a research phase. This initial phase will help gauge potential costs associated with land acquisition or leasing. A careful analysis will be conducted to determine the best approach, be it a permanent purchase for the attraction's longevity or a lease agreement to test the waters.

### **Local/Rural Community**:
The location could be a key element in engaging the local community and empowering them with local IRL jobs as well as knowledge of and access to the nouns ecosystem. There's potential for ecotourism integration as well.

---

## **Preliminary Research Proposal (Phase 1)**:
This phase 1 mission aims to lay the foundation by:

1. Scouting potential locations along the east coast highway.
2. Estimating costs associated with land acquisition or lease.
3. Gauging infrastructure and development costs for the three levels of the Giant Noggles attraction outlined below.

This preliminary research ensures a structured and informed approach to the larger vision, helping to anticipate challenges and allocate resources effectively.

---

## **Proposal Funding Levels (Phase 2)**

With such an extensive concept, there's a lot of ideas and room for growth. I foresee initial planning around the following 3 levels to accommodate the funding commitment/sentiment from the DAO when a full proposal candidate is presented in phase 2. These levels are an initial indication and are subject to change in structure as the research phase progresses. I am totally open to feedback and suggestions too.

### **Level 1: Minimal Viable Product (MVP)**
- **The Giant Noggles Structure**: A towering, monumental, eye-catching centerpiece that will serve as the primary attraction and memory-maker.
  
- **Oversized Noggles Props**: Interactive, freestanding noggles for visitors to enact the playful illusion of wearing them.

- **Automated Vending Machines**: Stocked with exclusive nounish merchandise, from wearables to collectibles. These machines not only offer visitors tangible memories but also support creators and manufacturers in the ecosystem while requiring minimal maintenance.

- **Self-Serve Photo Stations**: Areas furnished with panels featuring face holes, set against vibrant and creative backdrops, supported by permanent stands for phones/cameras for those easy timer shots.

- **Curated Art & Info Displays**: Artistic displays and panels introducing visitors to the nounish aesthetic and noteworthy contributors in the ecosystem.

### **Level 2: Enhanced Experience**
- **Nounish Museum & Retail Store**: A deeper dive into the nounish world, offering merchandise and a historical look at its evolution.
  
- **Food offerings**: Nounish-themed foods, enhancing the immersive experience for visitors.
  
- **Regular Contests & Events**: Organized activities to foster community engagement and ensure repeat visits.

- **Domain-Specific Nounish Communities Sections**: Focusing on various sub-communities within the larger nounish culture.

- **Interactive Learning Stations**: Digital screens elaborating on the history and significance of noggles.

- **Signage & Directional Guides**: Embedding nouns into the very fabric of the space for a holistic experience.

### **Level 3: Stretch Goals**
- **Art Gallery & Arcade**: Spaces dedicated to the visual appreciation of noggles-related art and playful engagement through interactive games.

- **Co-working Spaces & Events Area**: Multi-purpose spaces catering to the diverse needs of visitors, from professionals seeking a work spot to groups wanting event venues.

- **Essential Amenities**: Comprehensive facilities including bathrooms and showers for the convenience of visitors.

- **Climbing Experience Inside Noggles**: An adventurous add-on to make the primary structure itself a point of engagement.

- **Electric Car Charging Station**: A nod to the future with a Tesla Supercharger setup. Tesla provides these as long as your location meets their criteria, so installation is at their discretion.

---

## **Funding & Future**

I am adopting a two-phase approach:

- **Phase 1**: This initial phase focuses on comprehensive planning and research to lay the groundwork for a detailed and accurate candidate proposal in the future.

    I estimate around 50-100 hours will be spent gathering information. It's very likely that I'll need to travel to some locations to meet with land owners, real estate, local councils and businesses across potential locations - around 7-12hrs of driving in some cases.

    With all this in mind, I kindly request 7 ETH to cover costs for phase 1.
  
- **Phase 2**: Informed by the findings of Phase 1, this phase presents a detailed financial proposal. It will detail the costs for the MVP and offer insight into the potential expansion costs for the enhanced experience and stretch goals, while also presenting projected revenue streams and models for each.

This strategy ensures a minimal upfront investment in research, paving the way for a well-informed MVP proposal. By presenting the DAO with clear options and pricing in the next phase, there will be somewhat of a multiple choice on the candidate proposal where I will seek feedback from voters until support is clear and it gains a sponsor. We can all to decide together what the best plan of attack would be with the information at hand.

As the attraction garners increased attention and popularity, this vision extends beyond the MVP. Subsequent expansions are poised to transform The Giant Noggles from a novel tourist attraction into a lucrative venture. There's room for advertising, retail, workshops, events and even accommodation.

---

## **Conclusion**
**The Giant Noggles isn't just a structure; it's a narrative, an experience, a legacy in the making. I invite nouners to be part of this visionary journey, a chance to be etched in Australia's vibrant tourism tapestry.**

Thank you for your time and consideration!

content.title: Let's make a short animated film to fund the Protocol Guild
content.description:
# Let's make a short animated film to fund the Protocol Guild

[![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJuogvxb6.jpg)](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/npgcssj0xy1xyid9utxob/Nouns_Pitch.mov?rlkey=z8cgbr02oza3e6wl1h3scv54z&dl=0)

## TL;DR

Let’s make a ~45s short animated film to celebrate [Protocol Guild's](https://protocol-guild.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#) work on Ethereum, release it as a droposal, and donate the proceeds of the mint to fund Ethereum core development. This prop requests $400k USDC to hire [The Line](https://www.thelineanimation.com/), a BAFTA-nominated animation studio to make this short film. 
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Sy9sXPeZa.png)

## Edit note from candidate feedback

This prop has been updated from its candidate stage to fix a funding request typo. Also want to acknowledge the excellent feedback from Noun 40 and Trent re: shifting the framing of Protocol Guild from glamorous heroes to tireless stewards / maintainers in the co-created universe of Ethereum. We will work that feedback in with The Line and post an updated script via Propdate.

## Why support Protocol Guild? 
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1yDWDxWa.jpg)

Nouns love public art and software, and Protocol Guild maintains the most important public software to us: Ethereum. We've demonstrated this in the past to the [tune of 500 ETH](https://www.nounsagora.com/proposals/108). Instead of continuing with direct donation, I'm proposing that we leverage our financial and creative resources to make a film about PG, and release it as a mintable NFT whose proceeds go towards the Guild.

This is not only great for PG, but also affords us a unique opportunity to use nounish imagery, characters and themes in a piece of media that will widely seen in our prime demographic of humans who love and care for ethereum.

It's true that "donating" via a mintable film is more risky than giving money directly – but I think telling the story of Ethereum and Protocol Guild through the lens of Nouns is something we can uniquely do. Other DAOs like UNI and LIDO may be able to donate more due to their larger treasury – but none have the mission and mandate to fund creative endeavours like we do.

A successful $400k investment in storytelling can have a **broader reach** than our previous 500ETH investment and drive far **more direct positive attention** to Nouns while at the same time providing financial and cultural support to Protocol Guild. And we have evidence this can work, both from our [past](https://www.thisisnouns.wtf/) [successful](https://www.premiere.wtf/) droposals and the [Stand with crypto](https://zora.co/collect/eth:0x9d90669665607f08005cae4a7098143f554c59ef) mint.

## What's the story we're going to tell?

[![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJuogvxb6.jpg)](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/npgcssj0xy1xyid9utxob/Nouns_Pitch.mov?rlkey=z8cgbr02oza3e6wl1h3scv54z&dl=0)

Please watch Bjorn, our director, tell you the story, settings, and characters in his voice. We're working with a draft story and visual references, and will be refining it all over time with input from the Nouns community. Our current draft story is something like this:

>This is a story set in a floating port town, which metaphorically represents the Ethereum ecosystem. Everyone is gathered to celebrate the return of the Protocol Guild, a group of adventurers bringing back innovations that will improve the town (metaphorically EIP-4844). The Nouns play host to these adventurers by inviting them to a big feast. We follow a young child who looks up to the Protocol Guild and follows them across their journey around town, in hope of meeting his heroes.

If you'd like to check out [the draft script](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1T1Gw8W74_9BR_o6ADetRxnyxza-SPR7lZdof9jTPslg/edit?usp=sharing) yourself!


## The world and its characters
You should definitely check out Bjorn's video explaining the world in his own words, but check these images for a preview! And feel free to [flip through the reference deck yourself!](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1NI_MTJSPafHsAi-W37BWFQeDsi-uBFQe/view?usp=sharing)

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rJaijgagp.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJ6jogpl6.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/ryTijlpe6.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HkpjolTx6.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/r16ssgpea.jpg)



## Who's making the film?

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/r1OnCNL1a.jpg)

We're working with The Line – a BAFTA-nominated animation studio whose work span across work for major brands and original animation. They've worked extensively with top tier artists and brands like [Gorillaz](https://www.thelineanimation.com/work/gorillaz), [Lil Nas X](https://www.thelineanimation.com/work/lilnasx-star-walkin), and [Marvel Studios](https://www.thelineanimation.com/work/hero-marvel-snap), and [Nickelodeon](https://www.thelineanimation.com/work/nickelodeon-vines). Our director will be Bjorn-Erik Aschim, who's also a studio co-founder.

I reached out to them not only because they worked on a [viral Chobani video about a solarpunk farm](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z-Ng5ZvrDm4) – which I think visually and emotively embodies the vision the aspiration of Nouns and Ethereum really well, but also because they are one of the best studios in the world, whose work is widely recognized in the creative industry.

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/H11spyae6.png)

## Funding & milestones
**Funding**

I'm requesting $400k USDC to fund this short animation. 100% of the amount goes to The Line to fund the development of the film. The funds will be released over 2 milestones: 1/2 upfront, and 1/2 upon completion.

Milestone payment will be held in an escrow multisig whose signers are the Agora team and will be disbursed to The Line upon milestone completion. In the unlikely event that the film cannot be completed, the remainder funds will be returned to the DAO.

Then, trent.eth from Protocol Guild will submit another proposal to the DAO to release the short film as a droposal with 70% of the proceeds going to Protocol Guild, 20% to Nouns treasury, and 10% to Agora. 


## What's Agora / Yitong's role in this?
I'm incredibly excited about more Nouns-produced short films released as Droposals, because there's a real flywheel here if we can demonstrate that Nouns can create super high quality short films that also have real mint value. 

It's why we're working on an [easy Droposals](https://www.nounsagora.com/proposals/346) creator at Agora, and I can think of no better film than one about Ethereum itself to demonstrate the power of Droposals.


## Timeline
Dates are approximate, and may change by a few days depending on exact timing of the candidate approval. During the process, Yitong will serve as liaison between The Line and the Nouns community to make sure we have the chance to provide feedback during each phase of production.

w/c 19th Oct - Proposal approved (PAYMENT MILESTONE 1 50%)
w/c 26th Oct - Creative Phase commences
w/c 10th Nov - Creative Phase Deck Approval
w/c 16 Nov - Pre-production commences
w/c 30th Nov - Edit Lock & Designs approval
w/c 21th Dec - Layout approve
w/c 21th Dec - Production commences
w/c 25 Dec - Christmas Break
w/c 25th Jan - Animation approve
w/c 25th Feb - Comp approved
w/c 22 Feb - Final Delivery (PAYMENT MILESTONE 2 50%)


## A story in chapters

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/ryKSTlTeT.png)
If we're successful with this first film, we can serialize this into a series of short animations celebrating major Ethereum milestones so that we can both create an ongoing source of funding for Protocol Guild, and tell an episodic story that builds into a larger narrative and universe that can stand on its own and be appealing to a mass audience who might not even know about Nouns or Ethereum.

I’m thrilled to sponsor this proposal, as it aligns so neatly with my interests that coincide with Nounish culture.

My reasons for sponsorship:

- Proposal author and designated studio both have an impressive pedigree in their respective fields of work.

In addition, I am really interested in how Nouns can further proliferate its brand through creative projects that employ character development and explicit storytelling. This is how I personally become involved in Nouns — I was enchanted by the video NFT by Nounish on Zora, “Let’s Play Nouns DAO”.

# Sail Nouns: NFT NYC 2024

## TL;DR
Gather the Nounish community on a big boat during NFT.NYC. The New York evening view from a sailboat is the best place to take photos while wearing Noggles.

*Resubmission notes:
- As per feedback on [Prop386](https://nouns.wtf/vote/386), I am resubmitting the proposal for NYC.NFT sailing event.
- I reduced the budget that still can be enough for a classy gathering.
- You can also mint photos from last event on ZORA*

## Description
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HJjKkJqun.jpg)
Following the success of [Prop 102](https://nouns.wtf/vote/102) and [Prop 173](https://nouns.wtf/vote/173), I would like to organize a sailing event on April 3rd in New York with the help of the Manhattan Yacht Club. IMO, it is important to gather at least once a year to celebrate achievements, brainstorm ideas, and share nounish goods. I believe New York is the best place for such gatherings. It was an amazing experience to meet everyone for the first time in person during NFT.NYC 2023. I think next year, we will have even more loyal nounish people visiting New York.

## Burgee flag
We have a very beautiful flag with a meaning. *A white flag with red noggles symbolizes one noun! When you put many nouns burgee flags together, they symbolize the Nouns community.* The Nouns burgee flag debuted at the 2023 Nouns Sailing event during NFT.NYC, representing the spirit of Nouns and the tradition of the Nounish community. I would love to continue this tradition to distribute burgee flags at sailing event in NY.

## Mint photos
[MINT PHOTOS FROM NFTNYC2023 ON ZORA](https://zora.co/collect/zora:0x2d2505a06797a4b6a313c45e201d78834621e2b2)

![](https://pink-feminist-vole-608.mypinata.cloud/ipfs/QmWfRcMcvTpAaa2KApVzY7vuwWxsDUriPF2TCpj9LJviDd)

# Budget
- **$18,000** Rent sail yacht Arabella
- **$12,000** - Food and drinks by Manhattan Yacht Club
- **$5,000** - 120 Nouns burgee flags
- **$5,000** - 100 T-shirts (plus art by Messhup)

- **$12,000** - Unexpected expenses (tax, crew allowance etc)

**Subtotal: $58,000**

content.title: Sell Some Treasury Nouns
content.description:
# Sell Some Treasury Nouns

## TL;DR
Currently, there are only four nouns available for purchase on open markets. Herein, I propose to sell some treasury nouns at prices above the fork0-BV price. This initiative would provide individuals with the opportunity to acquire nouns from Season 1, offer the DAO a chance to expand the Nouners community, in addition to daily auctions, and generate additional capital for proliferation or burn.
A committee of five trusted members will manage listing of nouns via a 3/5 multi-sig.

## Description
This proposal aims to replenish the treasury and secure capital for further proliferation activities. Nouns had historically limited market availability, however there are indications that nouns are in demand; for example, Noun8 was sold for 49 ETH. Now that we have a treasury with lots of rare and beautiful nouns, I propose listing 15 nouns on open markets. This will help the DAO to refill the treasury and also attract new Nouners who appreciate the art, culture, and value of NounsDAO.
The committee members will determine prices based on market sentiment and in the best interest of the DAO. All ETH proceeds from sales and any remaining nouns will be transferred to the treasury after one month, which equates to 30 daily auctions.
Herein, I propose the following tiered pricing for nouns based on their numbers:

ids: 0-99 at 43~51 ETH
ids: 100-299 at 38~43 ETH

## Requested nouns
The sale of the following nouns should contribute 595~685 ETH to the treasury.

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/B1VxBo_e6.png)

## Policy and Rules
**1.1** The 15 treasury nouns will be sent to the multi-sig wallet, which is managed by 5 trusted members.
**1.2** The nouns held in the multi-sig safe are non-voting, meaning that the committee cannot use them for voting purposes.
**1.3** Committee members will determine prices in the best interest of the DAO.
**1.4** No treasury nouns shall be sold below the fork0-BV price.
**1.5** The candidate proposal feedback section shall be used for suggestions.
**1.6** The community is encouraged to propose committee members, and self-nomination is also encouraged.
**1.7** All ETH proceeds from sales and any remaining nouns will be transferred to the treasury after one month, which equates to 30 daily auctions.


## Multi-sig signers
This is a pro bono position, and committee members will receive a small amount of ETH to compensate for transaction fees only.

1. __
2. __
3. __
4. __
5. [Five](https://twitter.com/fiveoceans_dev)

## Multi-sig Tests
Here is an example of me successfully listing and selling an nft using "Safe", "0xNFTs by Castle", and "Blur".

https://app.safe.global/transactions/history?safe=eth:0x41DBB3ac3a10b37bA4490A6ef5FF41A97aE90960

## Transactions
1. Send 15 treasury nouns with early numbers to multi-sig
2. Send 1.5 ETH to multi-sig to compensate transaction fees (0.3 eth will be sent to each committee member)

## The proposer
This prop was ideated by [Five](https://twitter.com/fiveoceans_dev)

[In all this course fully sponsored by Nouns and people will see nouns icons everywhere and i will create all examples using nouns taits.]

Hello everyone im Yasin Aktimur [yasinaktimur](https://twitter.com/yasinaktimur) and im payment instructor of Udemy.

This is my [udemy course page](https://www.udemy.com/user/yasinaktimur/)

I have Courses about crypto currencies, p2p networking and cryptology like 

"How to build your own cryptocurrency exchange with python"

"How to code your own blockchain from scratch using python"

"I also have a Rust language Course too"

Im also mobile game developer on apple and i have my own game on appstore.
[bitfight's website](https://bitfight.wtf/) is game's website and you can download from here if you use iphone.

[bitfight appstore link](https://apps.apple.com/tr/app/bitfight/id6449154006)


This is a simple puzzle game and people also can play 2P "multiplayer" too.

I developed this game using swift but on-chain games and swift is have a interoperability problems.

I realized Progressive web apps and games will be a next thing on NFT's.

I just wanna rebuild my game from scratch using PWA.

Then i wanna create a new multi-language course on Udemy and explain

How to create Progressive web apps/games using Html, css, js and next.js

Then they are choose fully app-store based apps.

But with Web3 we need choose PWA's back.

I hope Noun'ers will help me for building future.

Im Y. Aktimur ı hope we will build something together!

content.title: Unstake all stETH from Lido
content.description:
# Unstake all stETH from Lido

*This candidate draft is put forward with the hopes of further feedback from the community.*

#### **Proposal**
As good Ethereum citizens [1], I propose we lead by example and unstake all [2] stETH. We currently hold a total of ~10836 stETH in the [treasury](https://etherscan.io/tokenholdings?a=0xb1a32FC9F9D8b2cf86C068Cae13108809547ef71).

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJSEZLTeT.png)


#### **Problems with Lido**
I recommend watching the video below to better understand the concerns with Lido, but in short:
-  Ethereum epochs require 2/3rds of attestors voting to finalize;
- Lido's node operators control almost 1/3rd of all validators (32.2% at the time of writing);
- Lido DAO decides who can be a node operator;
-  In every Lido DAO vote, over 50% of power is controlled by [just 2 or 3 participants](https://snapshot.org/#/lido-snapshot.eth);
-  That makes Lido an Ethereum 'middleware' with a huge amount of centralized power;
-  The risks are not unrecoverable but serious enough that we ought to choose a better path.


[![](https://i.imgur.com/1k18c2V.png)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y0ddkSa1ZuI&ab_channel=Web3Builders)
*Lido conversation starts at 17m30s, and ends at 27m30s. Another section on risks starts at 47m30s.*

#### **More resources**
- The blog post by Danny Ryan referenced in the video:
[https://github.com/djrtwo/writing/blob/main/docs/2022-05-30_the-risks-of-lsd.md](https://github.com/djrtwo/writing/blob/main/docs/2022-05-30_the-risks-of-lsd.md)
- Another Evan van Ness podcast with Ben Edgington (issues with governance start around 8min mark):
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WcGpHXTepcA&ab_channel=Web3Builders](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WcGpHXTepcA&ab_channel=Web3Builders)
- Recent Hasu post on future of Lido:
[https://research.lido.fi/t/hasus-goose-submission-proposed-goals-for-lido-dao-to-consider/5590](https://research.lido.fi/t/hasus-goose-submission-proposed-goals-for-lido-dao-to-consider/5590)
- Dune dashboard displaying Lido dominance:
[https://dune.com/hildobby/eth2-staking](https://dune.com/hildobby/eth2-staking)

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rJXenQTlp.png)


---

#### **Transactions (technicalities)**
Unstaking from Lido is a [two-step process](https://stake.lido.fi/withdrawals/request). This proposal deals with step one.

- Approve Withdrawal Queue to transfer any stETH amount owned by the DAO.
    - `0xae7ab96520DE3A18E5e111B5EaAb095312D7fE84.approve(0x889edC2eDab5f40e902b864aD4d7AdE8E412F9B1, uint256.max)`
- Request to withdraw 10837.24266 stETH. The request is split into batches up to 1K ETH due to a Lido [withdrawal limit](https://etherscan.io/address/0x889edC2eDab5f40e902b864aD4d7AdE8E412F9B1#readProxyContract#F6).
    - `0x889edC2eDab5f40e902b864aD4d7AdE8E412F9B1.requestWithdrawals([1000 ether, 1000 ether, 1000 ether, 1000 ether, 1000 ether, 1000 ether, 1000 ether, 1000 ether, 1000 ether, 1000 ether, 837.24266 ether], 0xb1a32FC9F9D8b2cf86C068Cae13108809547ef71)`

---

#### **Notes**
[1] In anticipation of the burn mech, it's necessary for us to reduce our stETH holdings since excess treasury value is denominated in vanilla eth. By reducing stETH, we are _also_ being good Nouns citizens and playing by the intended rules of the burn mechanic.

[2] Assuming this proposal executes, its up to the dao to decide if we want to re-stake, presumably with another solution. This proposal does not make any value judgment around whether Nouns DAO should stake or not; it is solely concerned about the risks of Lido.

*Thanks to Wiz for reading a draft, and Elad for helping with transactions.*

content.title: 🔥 The Burn: audit funding
content.description:
# 🔥 The Burn: audit funding

We are planning to propose an upgrade that implements [The Burn](https://w.mirror.xyz/AmHOzH-FQZVO3IhGXHSvCRxRSf2MO6VCZdmMwNEIyKE). The goals for the burn are described in the blog post above by wilson.

What's in this proposal text?

* High level design details
* Audit plan and budget request ($36K)

The burn code is in an advanced state, and if this proposal succeeds we hope to start the audit soon after.

## Technical spec

We plan to deploy a new contract, with a single function that lets burn excess ETH from the timelock.

### How much will be burned?

Excess ETH is defined as the difference between the treasury value denominated in ETH, and: adjusted_total_supply * trailing_N_day_mean_auction_price.

adjusted_total_supply is the number of minted nouns, excluding nouns held by the treasury or in the escrow contract.

In order to calculate the treasury value in ETH, the contract will consider only ETH, stETH, rETH & WETH. All other assets are ignored.

The number of auctions looked at when calculating the mean price is a configurable parameter; we suggest starting with 90.

Example based on numbers close to actuals:

Treasury has 2857 ETH, 10830 stETH, 228 rETH.
Adjusted total supply: 394.
Mean price of last 90 auctions: 30 ETH.
Treasury value in ETH: 2857 + 10830 + 247 (228 worth of rETH) = 13,934 ETH.
Excess ETH: 13,934 - 30 * 394 = 2114 ETH.

### What is burned?

Only ETH is burned. If the Nouns runs out of ETH, it will need to swap other assets (e.g. stETH) into ETH to allow for more burn.

### When can it be called?

The goal is for the burn to happen at predictable times. One parameter will define what will be the first noun id at which the first burn can happen. Another parameter will define how many noun ids need to be minted before the next burn can happen.

Example:

Suppose the first noun id is set to 1000, and the number of nouns between burns is set to 100. The first burn will be possible once a noun with id 1000 is minted. The next burn would be possible once a noun with id 1100 is minted.

Even if the first burn actually occurs when noun 1002 is auctioned, the next burn will still be possible starting id 1100.


### Timelock upgrade

The timelock will be upgraded to a new version which will allow the burner contract to call it an burn ETH.

The timelock will only allow the burner contract to call it.

The address of the burner contract is a configurable param. Setting it to the zero address is effectively turning off the burn mechanism.


## Audit costs

Our plan is to undergo a deep code review with solimander, and an audit with [Sherlock](https://www.sherlock.xyz/). In a bit more detail:

1. Soli review (+ verbs fix things)
2. Sherlock audit
3. Verbs fix things + soli reviews fixes
4. Sherlock mitigation review

We are asking for 36K USDC to be sent to the Tech Grants Pod multisig to pay for the audit. 30K USDC will go to auditors and 6K USDC will go to Sherlock.

## Next steps

Funding the audit will let us know the DAO wants the burn to be deployed. Once funded we will finalize the code, undergo the audit, and follow up with a proposal to upgrade the auction house contract and the treasury contract.

The upgrade will leave the burn disabled, since it seems best to separate the deployment of the mechanism from reaching consensus on its parameters. We will of course support any voters who will want to follow up with a proposal to set the burn parameters.

It's also worthwhile for voters to consider converting stETH into ETH ahead of the burn, since as mentioned above this simple design only burns native ETH.

## Appendix: pseudocode

ExcessETHBurner:

```

// configurable params:

uint numPastAuctions;

uint nextBurnNounId;

uint mintsBetweenBurns;

function burnExcessETH() {

    if (auction().nounId < nextBurnNounId) revert('Not yet');

    

    allowedTreasuryInETH = adjustTotalSupply() * meanAuctionPrice();

    excessETH = treasuryValueInETH() - allowedTreasuryInETH;

    amountToBurn = min(excessETH, timelock.balance);

    

    nextBurnNounId += mintsBetweenBurns;

    

    timelock.burnETH(amountToBurn);

}

function treasuryValueInETH() {

    return timelock.balance + stETH.balanceOf(timelock) + 

        wETH.balanceOf(timelock) + rETH.getEthValue(rETH.balanceOf(timelock));

}

function meanAuctionPrice() {

    return mean(auctionHouse.prices(numPastAuctions));

}

```


## Appendix: current asset breakdown

At the time of writing this text, [according to Etherscan](https://etherscan.io/tokenholdings?a=0xb1a32FC9F9D8b2cf86C068Cae13108809547ef71):



* Total treasury value is roughly $23.15M.
* Its two main assets are:
    * ETH at $4.391M (2631.493 ETH).
    * stETH at $18.061M (10830.768 stETH).
* These two assets alone make up over 96.7% of the total treasury value.
* USDC is roughly 1.1% of the treasury, and we’re comfortable ignoring it for the sake of code simplicity.
* wstETH is roughly 0.11% and is ignored as well.

content.title: GLITCH: Art residency + Prop House + Droposal
content.description:
# GLITCH: Art residency + Prop House + Droposal

# 

# DESCRIPTION
## TLDR;
GLITCH is a 2-weeks residency for blockchain artists and engineers embracing the principles of openness and collaboration. We want to set up a Prop House to fund public goods projects and artworks within the GLITCH collective and beyond, where the highest-ranked artworks will be submitted as a Droposal for Nouns.

**Total funds requested: 25 ETH**
* 10 ETH for the GLITCH residency (see below for more granular budget)
* 15 ETH for the Prop House Treasury

![GLITCH Community](https://drive.google.com/uc?id=126XxNSe_cLiVf0vE7tPmRHelc9c28-dg)

# GLITCH 3.0
The GLITCH art collective is organising the third edition of its art residency. It’s a 2 weeks long event gathering blockchain / AI artists and engineers, collaborating on the creation of new NFT collections inspired by the notion of CC-0 and Remix. GLITCH is a unique opportunity to build new types of public goods, past editions have led to the creation of several protocols (e.g. REMIX NFT, IMPACT NFT) as well as an open source NFT Token-Bound Licensing standard to embed Creative Commons-like licensing conditions directly into NFTs.

## ART RESIDENCY
GLITCH is a two-week focused residency at an 18th century chateau in France. About 40-50 participants will be invited to create, imagine, develop theories, build projects and standards aimed at supporting a new creative ecosystem of open creativity and digital abundance in the blockchain art world.  The participants will be a highly curated group of creative and smart individuals actively engaged with NFTs, art, music and AI. The goal is to bring the right people, in the right place, at the right time, and then let the magic happen.

At GLITCH, we strive to empower people with ideas, visions, and expertise, while providing space for our attendees to reach deep into their minds and forge better models together. We exist to disrupt the status quo and to manifest positive solutions for society.
The outcomes of the residency will be, first and foremost, a tight community of value-aligned people eager to collaborate with one another, new collaborations and synergies in order to shape the world of tomorrow. The residency will also promote a variety of new initiatives about how to promote the value of openness and interoperability in the blockchain art world. Expected deliverables include new NFT protocols that encourage remix and creativity, new NFT protocols geared towards maximization of social and environmental impact, as well as a variety of collaborative exhibitions for NFT artists. All content produced within the residency will be released and made available to all under Creative Commons licenses.

More details about the third edition of GLITCH can be found at the [following link](https://drive.google.com/uc?id=1xWfm3HfZJHDdlb8-7bhrVE4fWmNJDOhd)

![GLITCH overview](https://drive.google.com/uc?id=1EHB6ZJxOhGZOb1wWWz1YobCez6UViYop)

# GLITCH Prop House & Droposal

GLITCH is an avant-garde hub for blockchain art and innovation. We aim to utilize Prop House's pioneering mechanism to fund the creation of artworks and public goods that will be stewarded and/or mentored by the members of the GLITCH collective (artists, engineers, curators, etc). By harnessing Prop House's governance system, we aim to democratize the funding process, foster cross-pollination between the Nouns and GLITCH community, and support projects that contribute significantly to the blockchain art ecosystem.

## GLITCH Prop House

GLITCH will create a Prop House round for blockchain artists and engineers to propose artworks and public goods to be created during the GLITCH residency. Artworks can range from NFTs to physical installations; public good initiatives can range from developing open standard or open-source tools, organizing educational events, or supporting initiatives to promote the blockchain art space. Collaboration between artists, technologists, and other stakeholders will be strongly encouraged, leading to the creation of groundbreaking initiatives in the blockchain art world, and beyond.

Anyone can submit a proposal for a new artwork or public good and request a maximum of 3 ETH. The GLITCH and Nouns community members assess the proposals and vote to allocate funds to the initiatives that align with GLITCH's mission of openness, collaboration, and innovation. Votes can be cast both by Nouns holders and GLITCH-NFT holders (we will distribute a GLITCH-NFT to all current and previous GLITCH participants, around 90 people total). Nouns and GLITCH-NFTs have an equal weight of one vote. We want Nouns holders to have a say on the selection of the proposed projects so that we can get feedback from outside of the event, to ensure that the projects that are funded are relevant not only to the GLITCH community, but also to other communities across the Nouns and NFT space.

## GLITCH DROPOSAL

The successful proposals, if applicable (i.e. to the extent that they include the production of a digital artwork), will be proposed as a Droposal for Nouns. The proceeds from the Droposal will be split equally between Nouns DAO, GLITCH and the creator(s) of the artwork.

![GLITCH people](https://drive.google.com/uc?id=1LWgWO67u5aDXgF7vP5rQej8bkIDPJL1M)

# FUNDINGS

The full costs of the residency is **$60,000** (inclusive of accommodation and catering for all participants). We are requesting **10 ETH** to cover 1/4 of the costs. 

The Prop House will fund proposals for up to **3 ETH per proposal**. We need **15 ETH** to support at least 5 proposals.


We are requesting a total grant of **25 ETH** in order to implement this proposal:
* **10 ETH**: support of the GLITCH residency
* **15 ETH**: Prop House treasury

# TEAM
The GLITCH collective is stewarded by [Primavera De Filippi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Primavera_De_Filippi), [Will Papper](https://www.linkedin.com/in/wpapper/), [Isaac Patka](https://www.linkedin.com/in/isaac-patka-417b4328/) and many other amazing blockchain artists and engineers !

content.title: Issue DAO Token Redeemable for a Treasury Noun
content.description:
# Issue DAO Token Redeemable for a Treasury Noun

// Increase accessibility for NOUN grants by creating a token (supply = # of forked Nouns) that can redeemed for the treasury Noun of recipient's choice. 

Yes, we may want to work out a separate silo for inherently 'high-interest' Nouns. Generally, though, it could be useful to be able to grant the rights to claim (most) any Noun they choose rather than require coordination before the fact.

 There are many people I would like to nominate to receive and do not necessarily have the personal connection to work with them to identify their dream Noun.  It's also an awkward ask of someone: "take a bunch of time to contemplate a Noun you may or may not receive from a set of 400+ possibilities."

Lowering friction here might help get more Nouns where they belong.

content.title: 🔥 The Burn: audit funding
content.description:
# 🔥 The Burn: audit funding

We are planning to propose an upgrade that implements [The Burn](https://w.mirror.xyz/AmHOzH-FQZVO3IhGXHSvCRxRSf2MO6VCZdmMwNEIyKE). The goals for the burn are described in the blog post above by wilson.

This is a first draft of the proposal candidate through which we will ask the DAO to fund one or two audits of the implementation. We are putting it up even before we have quotes from auditors, in order to raise awareness among voters, stimulate the conversation, and listen to feedback.

## Technical spec

We plan to deploy a new contract, with a single function that lets burn excess ETH from the timelock.

### How much will be burned?

Excess ETH is defined as the difference between the treasury value denominated in ETH, and: adjusted_total_supply * trailing_N_day_mean_auction_price.

adjusted_total_supply is the number of minted nouns, excluding nouns held by the treasury or in the escrow contract.

In order to calculate the treasury value in ETH, the contract will consider only ETH, stETH, rETH & WETH. All other assets are ignored.

The number of auctions looked at when calculating the mean price is a configurable parameter; we suggest starting with 90.

Example based on numbers close to actuals:

Treasury has 2857 ETH, 10830 stETH, 228 rETH.
Adjusted total supply: 394.
Mean price of last 90 auctions: 30 ETH.
Treasury value in ETH: 2857 + 10830 + 247 (228 worth of rETH) = 13,934 ETH.
Excess ETH: 13,934 - 30 * 394 = 2114 ETH.

### What is burned?

Only ETH is burned. If the Nouns runs out of ETH, it will need to swap other assets (e.g. stETH) into ETH to allow for more burn.

### When can it be called?

The goal is for the burn to happen at predictable times. One parameter will define what will be the first noun id at which the first burn can happen. Another parameter will define how many noun ids need to be minted before the next burn can happen.

Example:

Suppose the first noun id is set to 1000, and the number of nouns between burns is set to 100. The first burn will be possible once a noun with id 1000 is minted. The next burn would be possible once a noun with id 1100 is minted.

Even if the first burn actually occurs when noun 1002 is auctioned, the next burn will still be possible starting id 1100.


### Timelock upgrade

The timelock will be upgraded to a new version which will allow the burner contract to call it an burn ETH.

The timelock will only allow the burner contract to call it.

The address of the burner contract is a configurable param. Setting it to the zero address is effectively turning off the burn mechanism.


## Audit costs

Our plan is to undergo a deep code review with solimander, and an audit with [Sherlock](https://www.sherlock.xyz/). In a bit more detail:

1. Soli review (+ verbs fix things)
2. Sherlock audit
3. Verbs fix things + soli reviews fixes
4. Sherlock mitigation review

We are asking for 30K USDC to be sent to the Tech Grants Pod multisig to pay for the audit.

## Next steps

Funding the audit will let us know the DAO wants the burn to be deployed. Once funded we will finalize the code, undergo the audit, and follow up with a proposal to upgrade the auction house contract and the treasury contract.

The upgrade will leave the burn disabled, since it seems best to separate the deployment of the mechanism from reaching consensus on its parameters. We will of course support any voters who will want to follow up with a proposal to set the burn parameters.

It's also worthwhile for voters to consider converting stETH into ETH ahead of the burn, since as mentioned above this simple design only burns native ETH.

## Appendix: pseudocode

ExcessETHBurner:

```

// configurable params:

uint numPastAuctions;

uint nextBurnNounId;

uint mintsBetweenBurns;

function burnExcessETH() {

    if (auction().nounId < nextBurnNounId) revert('Not yet');

    

    allowedTreasuryInETH = adjustTotalSupply() * meanAuctionPrice();

    excessETH = treasuryValueInETH() - allowedTreasuryInETH;

    amountToBurn = min(excessETH, timelock.balance);

    

    nextBurnNounId += mintsBetweenBurns;

    

    timelock.burnETH(amountToBurn);

}

function treasuryValueInETH() {

    return timelock.balance + stETH.balanceOf(timelock) + 

        wETH.balanceOf(timelock) + rETH.getEthValue(rETH.balanceOf(timelock));

}

function meanAuctionPrice() {

    return mean(auctionHouse.prices(numPastAuctions));

}

```


## Appendix: current asset breakdown

At the time of writing this text, [according to Etherscan](https://etherscan.io/tokenholdings?a=0xb1a32FC9F9D8b2cf86C068Cae13108809547ef71):



* Total treasury value is roughly $23.15M.
* Its two main assets are:
    * ETH at $4.391M (2631.493 ETH).
    * stETH at $18.061M (10830.768 stETH).
* These two assets alone make up over 96.7% of the total treasury value.
* USDC is roughly 1.1% of the treasury, and we’re comfortable ignoring it for the sake of code simplicity.
* wstETH is roughly 0.11% and is ignored as well.

content.title: 🧈 The Churn
content.description:
# 🧈 The Churn

//This is a proposal to protocolize distribution of Nouns that have been returned to the treasury via a permissionless forum similar to Prop House, allocated by Nouner vote. 


One way to understand the falling demand / fork cycle is as a referendum on the protocol's ability to maintain alignment with an expanding voter base. 

We may want to enshrine, as the highest order mandate for voters, that we aim to produce not near-term roi but a rich, magnetic culture anchored by a progressively more distributed governance network. With or without v3, it's more important token-holders stay than that they come in the first place. 

Thus

Rather than be focused on protecting price/bv, we could instead prioritize minimizing forks, not just when auction prices are low but high as well. The two objectives are likely at odds in the long term. The dao has already proved that it will de-circulate Nouns if it serves near-term capital interests. Attempting to peg auction price to treasury balance via a periodic burn does not fundamentally change this.

Because

As long as natural demand is falling (price<bv), the highest marginal buyer at auction is still likely to be a value extractor. This is self-evident when fork threshold < allowed burn frequency, but is also the case generally. There is no way to eliminate the arb under this market condition via burn, meaning there can be be little/no supply expansion under price contraction.  

And 

When periods of price & supply expansion (price>bv) reverse, the dao will be under significant & possible cascading exit pressure in the form of profit-taking. We may find the token supply ultimately little changed. Nouns lifers will be palliated by an increased voting share in the dao (as with fork # 0), rather than rightfully held to task for failing to value progressive decentralization, inclusivity and organic leadership churn.  

And So 

I suggest we encode the recirculation of treasury nouns at a predictable cadence after forks (N/year until fully distributed). 

Fork execution schedules a series of on-chain prop house-style rounds (perhaps triggered by a modified auction settlement process?) where anyone can apply to be granted a Noun via a weighted vote governed by Noun-owners. Imo the most visceral/memetic steady-state value for N is 365. We can ramp up responsibly but lets not take an eternity. 

This maximizes alignment on growing the Nouns holder base, rather than near-term auction demand, minimizes arb interest and downstream rugs. It affords ardent Nouns believers a direct, merit-based pathway to agency in the network, and demonstrates we are immutably committed to a diverse and expanding range of interesting voices contributing to the conversation- the highest good for us, Ethereum, and beyond.

Nouns belong to the world.

content.title: Nouns Stories + Stoopid Buddy = Shorts Galore
content.description:
# Nouns Stories + Stoopid Buddy = Shorts Galore

# 

# 

## TLDR

On the heels of [Prop 180](https://nouns.wtf/vote/180)’s and [Prop 73](https://nouns.wtf/vote/73)’s overwhelming success, we’re rallying the creative forces once again on what promises to be our biggest and most impactful proposal yet. Nouns Stories is seeking $1,795,000 to develop, produce and distribute over 50 Animated Nouns Shorts on a global scale with nine time Emmy-Award winners Stoopid Buddy Stoodios, along with 50 of the best animators in the world.

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/SyIYuo7gp.png)

[Nouns Short Shorts Trailer](https://youtu.be/QxrvHepTh38)

## NOUNS: FRONT AND CENTER

Most sources of financing for animated content are tied to networks that move at a snail’s pace and that are not considered artist friendly. This is where Nouns steps in to disrupt the system. We want to provide the proper funding to attract the world’s best animators, help them bring their ideas to life, and in so doing — put Nouns DAO on the map as the number one source for innovative, diverse storytelling in animation. 

Not only that, but by making Nouns DAO the seed funder we’re putting the Nouns IP (and the brand’s aesthetic) front and center on a series of innovative and hilarious shorts that are bound to get massive amounts of attention with animation fans all around the world. What better way to spread the Nounish vibes and garner some positive attention?

## PERSON, PLACE & THING: 3 THEMATIC ROUNDS, 50 CREATORS, 1 YEAR

Over the course of the next twelve months we’ll onboard 50 of the world’s most innovate animators to create engaging animated shorts featuring great characters, engaging storylines, and Nounish vibes. By expanding the run times and upping the budgets, we’ll give the animators the opportunity to produce even MORE engaging visuals and storylines!

We’ll roll out the animated shorts over three themed rounds. Other than requiring the films to feature Nouns characters or Noggles, we’ll encourage the animators to go absolutely wild with the best and funniest ideas: the ones that may not exist within the walled gardens of Hollywood. Because not every artist has the bandwidth to produce longer form shorts, we’ll keep the Short Shorts 15 second+ format for some of our creators. 

In total the three themed rounds will feature:

- 12 x 2-3 minute Shorts
- 38 x 15-30 second Short Shorts
- 3 original shorts by the team at Stoopid Buddy

## 50 OF THE WORLD’S BEST

We’ll cast our net wide to onboard the best animators we can muster, and by allowing them the creative freedom to ***************do what they do***************, we believe we’ll get the very best out of them. Not only that, but many of these talented folks already have huge followings online which will further expose the Nouns DAO to their legions of fans when we go live with the shorts and the post them to their own socials.

## 3 STOOPID SHORTS

To kick off each thematic round, Stoopid Buddy Stoodios will pour all of their Nouns-lovin’-energy (see: Rose Parade / forthcoming Nouns Documentary) into making something truly special for Nouns — a love letter in animation like only they can. They’ll tap their A-list Buddies to create and voice these fully original mini-movies, creating some hilarious cohesion to what promises to be a wildly eclectic program!

## CC0 Heroes

As we did in the first Nouns Short Shorts Festival, we’ll encourage each animator to embrace Nounish culture by opting in to making their shorts CC0. While it won’t be required, opting into to CC0 will make their films eligible for some damn [fine awards](https://twitter.com/nouns_stories/status/1670029456688418818) and cash prizes!

## OH YEAH…ONE MORE THING

We’ll be hosting a *Nountastic* IRL animation festival to premiere these amazing shorts, attracting Nounish animation fans from all over the world.   Why do this when we could just hide behind the safety of our computer monitors? Because as we experienced with the first screening at [Braindead Studios](https://studios.wearebraindead.com/) in Los Angeles (in conjunction with the Melbourne screening at Pixel), there’s an *energy* and *magic* to bringing communities together to share in a truly unique experience that will help put Nouns DAO on the map. We’ll invite all our industry pals, and will we live-stream the whole thing just as we did before? Abso-fucking-lutely!

## IMPACT: NETWORK EFFECT

The first round of shorts garnered over **a million views** in the first month of release across creator and owned social channels. Most of these views were native to the creator channels of the animators themselves — providing a whole new audience for Nouns. This time around, we’ll not only continue to seek out animators with their own audiences, but amplify views across all platforms with a social media marketing campaign and enlisting a PR firm to bolster [awareness](https://www.animationmagazine.net/2023/07/stoopid-buddy-stoodios-chris-waters-unzips-about-the-nouns-short-shorts-festival/) of what we’re up to. On top of this, to build anticipation and excitment for the festival as the year unfolds, we'll create original promotional content, including teasers and trailers, behind the scenes footage, and creator profiles.
Check out some of the postings from our first Shorts Shorts Festival below!

[![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Hy2i70Kxa.jpg)](https://www.instagram.com/reel/Ctm_qiRBIre/)
[![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/By3o7AtxT.jpg)](https://www.instagram.com/p/CttDyBBo33G/)
[![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S13oQ0Yxp.jpg)](https://www.instagram.com/reel/CtgbaWPJ9iK/)


## THE NOUNS STORIES TEAM

**Stoopid Buddy Stoodios**

9 time Emmy-winning studio behind *Robot Chicken,* and producer of over 1,000 hours of animated television **including: *Crossing Swords, Mickey Saves Christmas, and Marvel’s MODOK.* Stoopid Buddy is a pioneering independent studio that has helped drive the tremendous growth in adult animation over the past decade. Co-founder Eric Towner and Head of Development Chris Waters have deep roots in the Nouns ecosystem. Their first proposal funded the Nouns Rose Parade Float (seen by over 30 million people) and both are producers of the forthcoming documentary about Nouns.

**Walter Newman**

Former SVP of program development at Adult Swim who oversaw such shows as Rick & Morty, Tuca and Bertie, Smiling Friends, Black Dynamite, and more. Walter brings network experience and a deep talent roster to the Nouns Stories team.

**Goldy** / **Pixel**

**[Goldy's](https://twitter.com/Goldypix)** Oscar-Shortlisted hybrid production studio is behind **[nounish ⌐◨-◨](https://twitter.com/nounish)** and the animated short film "**[The Wizards Hat](https://twitter.com/nouns_stories/status/1570433066900017152?s=20&t=T_vYbAun_YQEsZUlEwfjSA)**" from the original Nouns Stories proposal.

**Joshua Fisher**

Manager of Grammy-winning music producers, music publisher, SharkDAO Rep, Ugly Noun, The Nouns Square co-founder, Nouns DAO Builder and Nouns narrative advocate.

**Joel Cares**

CEO of **[Lobal Global](https://lobal.global/) / [ANOA](https://anoa.ca)**, creator of **[Nerman](https://twitter.com/nermanbot)**, founding member of **[Nouncil](http://nouncil.wtf/)**, creative director @ [**JoelCares.net**](https://joelcares.net).

## OUR ROLES

We’ve got the experience, knowledge, and relationships to successfully pull off this wildly ambitious proposal. Not only will we be identifying top-tier talent from our own networks of creators, but we’ll also be recruiting on a global scale to identify and onboard the next generation of up-and-coming animation talent.

We’ll be managing and coordinating a massive effort to create decentralized content and creatively package it in a way that connects with audiences around the globe. Not only that, but we’ll be tapping our extensive network to best position our exposure and distribution of the program online, at festivals, and beyond. We’ll be coordinating a social media / marketing and PR strategy, as well as presenting “behind the scenes” access and status updates to the DAO as this undertaking fully develops.

## BEYOND THE PROP

The Nouns Stories team has over 613,620ish hours of experience in animation development, production, marketing, distribution and sales. Our team is well positioned to take these Nounish creations beyond what is promised in the proposal. Our hope is we can continue to develop the best-of-the-best beyond their existence as a short, and seed Nounish content and characters into the mainstream zeitgeist. Think about it — *The Simpsons*, *South Park*, *Rick & Morty*, and hell, even *Robot Chicken*, all got their start **********as animated shorts.**********

## THAT’S A WRAP!

Animation drives cultural conversation. There’s a white space in animation that Nouns DAO is uniquely positioned to fill. Nimble development. Artist friendly. Global reach. We believe there’s a more “Nounish” way to produce the next great animated shorts, and that we have the team to help find them and make them. 

For Nouns, there’s an opportunity to be front-and-center in one of the most passionate arenas in pop culture and create break-out successes that proliferate the meme.

Our team has poured our hearts and souls into the Nouns experiment since it’s inception, and we’ve proven we can develop world-class animation and execute on ambitious ideas. We believe in a new way of generating content and organizing passionate communities of creators and fans. Together we can change the culture and build Nouns DAO into the next great destination for animation, so slap on your dang Noggles and let’s do this!!

## BUDGET BREAKDOWN

**TOTAL: $1,795,000 USDC** 
50% distributed upon commencement, 50% upon completion of first round.

**Animation** **************Content - $1,270,000**************

- 12 x 2-3 min shorts (3 rounds, 4 per round, $20k/short) - $240K
- 38 x 15-30 sec Short Shorts (3 rounds, 12 to 13 shorts per round, $7.5k/short) - $285K
- Three Original Shorts + packaging from Stoopid Buddy - $450K
- Nounish Trailers / Behind-the-Scenes / Festival Recap Docs / Creator Profiles - $150K
- “CC0 Hero” Awards (3 rounds, 15K per round) - $45K
- Animation Festival - $100K

**Management and Production - $430K** 

- Exec Producer Fees - $300K
    - artist outreach and curation
    - creative oversight and curation
    - promotion
- Producer - $100K
    - Animator management
    - Scheduling, Accounting and Deliverables
- Web build and upkeep - $30K

************************************General Operations - $95K************************************

- Publicist - $15K
- Social Media Mgr - $15K
- Legal+Accounting - $20K
